greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Largest number not the sum of n distinct nonzero squares.
comment: Halter-Koch essentially finds (5)-a(12) (with a coprimality condition, but Bateman, Hildebrand, & Purdy show that this can be dropped). - _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Mar 18 2014
link: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n = 5..400 (from Bateman et al.)
Paul T. Bateman, Adolf J. Hildebrand, and George B. Purdy, Sums of distinct squares, Acta Arithmetica 67 (1994), pp. 349-380.
Franz Halter-Koch, Darstellung natürlicher Zahlen als Summe von Quadraten, Acta Arithmetica 42 (1982), pp. 11-20.
xref: Cf. A120951 (numbers that are not the sum of 5 distinct nonzero squares).
results.author: _T. D. Noe_, Apr 03 2007
